content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

user_context_message_data.about_model_message:
don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct.

entries.title: Using Language Interpretation in your meeting or webinar - Zoom
entries.snippet: Host can designate up to 20 participants as language interpreters for a Zoom meeting or webinar. When the meeting or webinar starts, the host can start the interpretation feature which will allow the interpreters to provide their own audio channels for the language they are translating to. Attendees can then select the audio channel to hear the translated audio in their language of choice, as ...

entries.title: Use live captions in Microsoft Teams meetings - Microsoft Support
entries.snippet: Notes: Live translated captions in meetings are available as part of Teams Premium and Microsoft 365 Copilot, an add-on license that provides additional features to make Teams meetings more personalized, intelligent, and secure. To get access to an eligible license, contact your IT admin. If the meeting organizer has a Teams Premium or Microsoft 365 Copilot license, all meeting participants ...

entries.title: Interpreter in Microsoft Teams meetings - Microsoft Support
entries.snippet: Ensure the meeting organizer has either a Microsoft 365 Copilot or Teams Premium license. Turn on multilingual speech recognition in your meeting options so all participants can individually select their spoken languages and translation settings for live captions for clear communication with or without Interpreter.

entries.title: KUDO | Live Speech Translation & Captions in 200 Languages
entries.snippet: The #1 solution for human and AI-powered live speech translation on any platform—remote, hybrid, or in-person. Get our platform or app.

entries.title: Live Speech Translation For Meeting & Event Platforms | KUDO
entries.snippet: Add AI or human-translated audio and captions to your online meeting or event platform. Microsoft Teams, Zoom, and other integrations.

entries.title: Enterprise-Grade Remote Simultaneous Interpretation | Interprefy
entries.snippet: The Interprefy Remote Simultaneous Interpretation (RSI) platform is designed to integrate smoothly with your existing AV setup or preferred event platform. Whether you're using Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Google Meet or another platform, Interprefy can easily connect with it, ensuring that your event runs without any hitches.

entries.title: Remote Simultaneous Interpretation Interprefy
entries.snippet: Remote Simultaneous Interpretation What Is It ? Simultaneous interpretation is the real-time rendering of spoken or signed language into another, preserving meaning and tone. When done remotely, it enables interpreters to work securely from any location using a cloud-based platform, without the need for physical booths or on-site equipment.

entries.title: Live Translation Options for MS Teams in 2025: Interpretation and AI ...
entries.snippet: What happens when not everyone speaks the same language in your Microsoft Teams meeting? That’s where interpretation and live translation solutions like remote simultaneous interpretation, AI-powered speech translation, live AI captions and subtitles come in. Microsoft Teams has come a long way in supporting multilingual meetings.

entries.title: Interprefy Integrations for Events, AV Systems and Platforms
entries.snippet: Interprefy Inject is an integration solution that delivers simultaneous interpretation, AI speech translation, and live captions directly into your meeting platform's audio feed, so participants can listen in their chosen language without needing to open a separate app or browser tab. In simple terms, it “injects” the interpreted audio back into platforms like Microsoft Teams, Zoom, or ...

entries.title: Zoom Simultaneous Interpretation: Connecting the World One Language at ...
entries.snippet: Zoom simultaneous interpretation is a feature available on Zoom Meetings and Webinars that allows real-time language translation during a live event. This feature enables interpreters to translate what a speaker is saying while they are speaking—without any pauses or interruptions—allowing participants to listen to the translated content in ...

entries.title: KUDO Interpreter Marketplace FAQ - KUDO Support
entries.snippet: KUDO Certified interpreters are conference interpreters who have completed KUDO’s vetting process, designed to ensure the professional's quality and experience with Remote Simultaneous Interpretation, connectivity and technical requirements, and skills to interpret without supervision and on short notice.

entries.title: Appendix C How to Use Simultaneous Interpretation in Zoom Proceedings
entries.snippet: Simultaneous Interpretation Function1 Zoom offers a language interpretation feature that allows interpreters to interpret in the simultaneous mode2 while the LEP individual listens to the interpretation on a separate audio channel. When this feature is enabled, the other participants do not hear the interpretation.3 Language Interpretation Setup To allow Hosts/Schedulers of meetings on your ...

entries.title: How to i set up translation caption in a live teams meeting
entries.snippet: To set up translation captions in a live Microsoft Teams meeting, you need to ensure that you have the Teams Premium license, as this feature is part of that offering.

entries.title: Remote simultaneous interpretation - presencegroup.eu
entries.snippet: It is a remote simultaneous interpreting platform specifically designed to run multilingual web meetings smoothly. ‍ KUDO offers the latest cloud-based technology, combined with professional interpreting so you can meet globally in your own language.

Connect people in their own language by utilizing Interprefy's powerful combination of cloud-based remote simultaneous interpretation technology, unmatched language talent and professional services ...

entries.title: Interprefy Remote Simultaneous Interpretation
entries.snippet: With Interprefy, you can add real-time language interpretation from professional conference interpreters to your Microsoft Teams meetings. Connect people in their own language by utilizing Interprefy's powerful combination of cloud-based remote simultaneous interpretation technology, unmatched language talent and professional services.

entries.title: Instructions for using simultaneous translation during a Zoom meeting
entries.snippet: Locate and select the “Interpretation” button on the bottom of your Zoom Meeting screen. This will be in the same row of controls that includes “Participants,” “Chat,” etc. You may have to move your mouse for this row of controls to appear.

entries.title: Language Interpretation in Zoom - City of Madison, Wisconsin
entries.snippet: How does simultaneous interpretation work in Zoom? Interpreters are assigned two languages to interpret between in Zoom. Participants must select an audio channel other than the original audio channel. Interpreters audio can be heard in the audio channel they select.

entries.title: Understanding Microsoft Teams Language Translation Capabilities in Meetings
entries.snippet: Microsoft keeps expanding Teams with new language translation capabilities, including live translated captions, Multilingual Speech Recognition, and the Interpreter Agent. Here’s how these features differ.
